metadata.title: USN-7072-2 -- Linux kernel (GKE) vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Several security issues were discovered in the Linux kernel. An attacker could possibly use these to compromise the system. This update corrects flaws in the following subsystems:   - Watchdog drivers;   - Netfilter;   - Network traffic control; (CVE-2024-38630, CVE-2024-27397, CVE-2024-45016)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-7072-2` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  linux-buildinfo-5.15.0-1068-gke - 5.15.0-1068.74 linux-gke-headers-5.15.0-1068 - 5.15.0-1068.74 linux-gke-tools-5.15.0-1068 - 5.15.0-1068.74 linux-headers-5.15.0-1068-gke - 5.15.0-1068.74 linux-image-5.15.0-1068-gke - 5.15.0-1068.74 linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1068-gke - 5.15.0-1068.74 linux-modules-5.15.0-1068-gke - 5.15.0-1068.74 linux-modules-extra-5.15.0-1068-gke - 5.15.0-1068.74 linux-tools-5.15.0-1068-gke - 5.15.0-1068.74 No subscription required  linux-gke - 5.15.0.1068.67 linux-gke-5.15 - 5.15.0.1068.67 linux-headers-gke - 5.15.0.1068.67 linux-headers-gke-5.15 - 5.15.0.1068.67 linux-image-gke - 5.15.0.1068.67 linux-image-gke-5.15 - 5.15.0.1068.67 linux-tools-gke - 5.15.0.1068.67 linux-tools-gke-5.15 - 5.15.0.1068.67 No subscription required
